content:
An abyssal rift in the seafloor at the Temple of the Eye, leading to the Scar.

The Scar is an area of Abyssal Space that is considered to be the most dangerous part of the Abyss.[1] A rift leading to it is found within the Temple of the Eye, where abyssal creatures come through it; the rift is periodically closed as part of the Guardians of the Rift minigame.

Though the Scar is currently inaccessible by players, Mod Ed has confirmed that it will be at some point in the future.[2]

History[edit | edit source]

Third Age[edit | edit source]

At some point during the Third Age, after the Betrayal of Zaros, either Zaros' or Zamorak's followers tried to claim the "Eye" (the Stone of Jas) which Saradomin had stored in the Temple of the Eye. Due to a lack of proper understanding in abyssal magic, these followers accidentally opened a rift to the Scar, where abyssal creatures poured out of. After a long battle that ended with a Saradominist victory, Justiciar Aliya, the Justiciar of the Lion, sealed the connection between the Scar and the temple and created Guardians of the Rift to defend the area should the rift somehow open again.[3]

Due to the temple eventually sinking underwater, the inhabitants of the Scar have since changed to a more deep sea-like appearance.

Fifth Age[edit | edit source]

During year 169 of the Fifth Age, Wizard Persten acquired a strange amulet and flagged down a passing adventurer in Al Kharid who had knowledge of the Abyss and the Z.M.I. Using their connections with the Zamorakian organisation, the adventurer was able to discover the location of the temple deep underneath Morytania's ocean. During the exploration, the adventurer and Apprentice Cordelia discovered remnants of the Scar in the temple which the adventurer recognised[4] but Cordelia cut them off. After reporting all of the discoveries, Persten mistakenly believed that Saradominist wizards had used the temple to speed up rune production and casted a revealing spell to check if the temple held any other secrets.[5] However, her spell instead reopened the rift leading to the Scar, which subsequently dragged her inside and abyssal creatures began pouring out of the breach.

The Great Guardian, sensing the reopening of the abyssal rift, awakened and gave vague instructions into what needed to be done. Fortunately, the apprentices were able to understand what it meant through the various items and debris scattered across the temple, allowing the adventurer to provide enough energy for it to close the rift. However, the Great Guardian warned them that without the Eye, the rift to the Scar would only be temporarily closed[6] and told the humans to leave, but the apprentices chose to stay to atone for their mistake. The adventurer reported the information to Archmage Sedridor, who promised to help the apprentices and research a way to close the rift, if possible. As of now, the apprentices, assisted by many adventurers, work to prevent the monsters from invading the rest of Gielinor.

Then, with the power from this 'Eye' and support from their rune guardians, they'd have been able to create runes at lightning speed! The Eye must have had a huge impact on their work. They named the temple after it and fashioned a symbol based on it."
